text: Scott we have a story in the paper today
of course as you well know about the
arrest in Pakistan of a Taliban leader
by the name of mullah Abdul Gani barata
first of all can you tell us how
significant is this arrest what does it
mean to the talibans organization it's
very significant because mullah barata
is the the really really the key
military leader of the Taliban the guy
who oversees the insurgency in
Afghanistan against the Karzai
government in NATO and American troops
he is really the key figure mullah
mohammed omar who many Americans would
know as the one-eyed leader of the
Taliban is is really more of a
figurehead or an overall leader of the
organization the movement but in terms
of actually commanding operations in
Afghanistan and really overseeing this
the military strategy to Taliban
mahabharata-- is the key person so it's
very significant it's quite interesting
that he was arrested in Pakistan and can
you give us a sense of what it means
about the relationship of Pakistani
intelligence and the united states that
pakistan cooperated in this arrest well
pakistani intelligence had a role in the
creation of the taliban in support of
the Taliban for years and after 2001
after nine eleven the American invasion
drove a Taliban out and the leaders fled
into Pakistan and they're known as the
Quetta Shura because they they operated
for four years around the Pakistani city
of Quetta in more recent times the
leaders are believed to have moved into
the cities and particularly into the big
city of Karachi in Pakistan but they
have been essentially overseeing the
insurgency in Afghanistan from Pakistan
now the significance of the Pakistani
intelligence and the CIA working
together apparently to catch and
question mahabharata--
is is very significant the Pakistani
intelligence for for a long time has had
ties to the Taliban Afghan Taliban
leadership and some cynical observers
would say that perhaps Pakistani
intelligence could have delivered this
arrest at an earlier time and may have
some reason for doing it now but in any
case if the CIA is working closely with
the ISI Pakistan's Intelligence
Organisation it could bode well for the
u.s. effort in Afghanistan I'm curious
Scott we know that the pressure has been
brought to bear on Pakistan by the
United States government for just this
sort of cooperation do you think this is
a result of that pressure it could well
be the Pakistani intelligence service
has for a long time maintain ties to
militants in Afghanistan as a sort of
counter way to the into the influence of
India Pakistan's great rival and only in
recent times has the Pakistani
government come under direct attack
itself from some of the militant groups
in the borderlands between Pakistan and
Afghanistan and in the tribal areas of
Pakistan and so Pakistan has begun to
respond more aggressively to the
militants and certainly there's been
American pressure to do that this still
caught a lot of people by surprise both
that it was possible to catch mullah
broader and also that the Pakistanis
were part of engineering this important
arrest
